intro: Avenula lodunensis subsp. romero-zarcoi, commonly known as the Romero-Zarcoi sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Mexico. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its morphology features narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The species is characterized by its unique floral structure and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity.
